label: AB_oC8_67_a_g-002
title: $\alpha$-PbO Structure
comments:
This is the orthorhombic low temperature form reported by (Boher, 1985), with data taken at 2K. They claim a transformation to the \href{current_web_home_dir/AB_tP4_129_a_c-001}{tetragonal ($B10$) PbO phase} at about 77K. 
 There is very little difference between the structures.  Indeed, with the standard tolerance setting AFLOW (and VASP) agree that both structures are tetragonal.  We can only resolve the difference by calling VASP with a tighter tolerance: 
 aflow -{-}proto=AB\_oC8\_67\_a\_g -{-}tolerance=0.001 -{-}params=a,c/a,z$_{2}$ . 
 \href{current_web_home_dir/AB_oC8_67_a_g-001}{$\alpha$-FeSe} and \href{current_web_home_dir/AB_oC8_67_a_g-002}{$\alpha$-PbO} have the same AFLOW prototype label, AB\_oC8\_67\_a\_g. They are generated by the same symmetry operations with different sets of parameters ({\tt --params}) specified in their corresponding CIF files.
